newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australia energy exports to Korea seen rising.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australia energy exports to Korea seen rising.

text.p: The value of Australia's energy exports to South Korea could rise to A$2.5 billion by 2005 from A$1 billion in 1995, the Australian Bureau of Agricultural and Resource Economics (ABARE) said.
The actual figure will be largely determined by developments in the coal and liquified natural gas markets, ABARE said.

Coal is likely to continue to dominate the bilateral energy trade relationship of the two nations, with steaming coal for electricity generation expected to become significantly more important than coking coal for Korea's iron and steel industries, ABARE said.
If Australia maintains its share in coal exports to Korea, bilateral trade could rise to 27 million tonnes in 2005 from 17 million in 1995, ABARE said.
The value of the exports is projected to rise to about A$1.4 billion in 2005 from A$900 million in 1995, the agency said.
Moreover, an emergence of substantial LNG trade under long-term contracts would significantly increase the total enery trade links between Australia and Korea, ABARE said.
